Well, so that would either be the defendant or the prosecutor, right? A. Yes. Q. Which is a party in the litigation, correct? A. Yes. Q. OK. And in a civil case, you're going to be either hired by the plaintiff or the defendant's lawyer, correct? A. Correct. Q. Now, they don't tell you to go out and just do an independent investigation on your own and then report back to them, whoever hires you. True? A. I -- I'm asked to do an independent investigation as it pertains to the specific question I'm being asked to answer in the course of my evaluation. Q. Yes, I understand that. But whoever hires you gives you material to review and then asks you a specific question based on the material that that party has given you, correct? A. Not necessarily, no. Q. Have you ever had a lawyer who hired you just say, go out and do whatever you want to do, bill me however much you want to bill me, and then tell me what your findings are? Has that ever happened in your career? A. In that specific way, no. SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00007976
